intro: Seseli degenii, commonly known as the Degen's seseli, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seseli degenii is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
